alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 18 at 2:44AM PDT until October 19 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, increased threat of sneaker waves and current activity. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 17 to 22 feet with focal points pushing 30 feet. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast Counties. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 2 AM PDT today through Thursday morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from 7 AM to 7 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These sneaker waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath. Large turbulent surf may be difficult to escape or achieve rescue.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing rip currents, localized beach erosion and sneaker waves. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
